posts.author: Kirrh
posts.content:
Greetings and well met. Kinda new to these forums and very glad to meet you all, since I ve been in love with this game for almost 20 years now and I ve recently discovered that the experience can be enriched with all the wonderful modules available.

I own both Enhanced Edition and Diamond Edition, but unfortunately a lot of old modules are not yet 'enhanced' vor the Enhanced Edition. I have some questions
1) are there mods to enhance the Diamond edition of the game (which don t interfere with other modules) ? Like bringing in some QoL adjustments similar to the ones in the Enhanced Edition (e.g. bigger UI / Fonts).
2) Is it possible to also play NWN Diamond in borderless window?


Any suggestions are more than welcome. Cheers.

posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content:
Kirrh,

Glad to meet you.   There are indeed some enhancements you can use.  I have used these in both EE and Diamond.  They go into your override directory.
AmethystDragon Enhancements

There are also packs you can find that redo various models for monsters etc.  I use one for skeletons/zombies and one for Elementals.  I dont have links for those though.   But I'm sure you can find them at the link above if you search.

There is a portraits directory as well and you can add custom artwork here so that you have more choices in head pics for your toon.

Hope that gives you a place to start.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I don't know if this one still applies, but if you fancy playing Aielund, it has/had its own enhanced edition, which came out not long before Beamdog's EE. Confusing, I know. I still play 1.69, so couldn't tell you if one has been subsumed into the other, but Aielund's own version certainly boosted the graphics.

And welcome aboard!

posts.author: BluntAxe
posts.content:
Some things that I found improved my NWN experience before EE.

NWN Facelift
-A simple override that makes nearly all tilesets look better in game.
Face lift

NWN Shader
-Adds depth of field
-Adds bloom
NWShader

BG2 GUI
-Reskins the nwns GUI (game user interface) with a Baldur's Gate 2 theme.
BG2 GUI
